nodes.Description:
CWE-324: Use of a Key Past its Expiration Date
The product uses a cryptographic key or password past its expiration date, which diminishes its safety significantly by increasing the timing window for cracking attacks against that key.
nodes.label: Use of a Key Past its Expiration Date

nodes.Description:
CWE-416: Use After Free
Referencing memory after it has been freed can cause a program to crash, use unexpected values, or execute code.
nodes.label: Use After Free

nodes.Description:
CWE-415: Double Free
The product calls free() twice on the same memory address, potentially leading to modification of unexpected memory locations.
nodes.label: Double Free

nodes.Description:
CWE-298: Improper Validation of Certificate Expiration
A certificate expiration is not validated or is incorrectly validated, so trust may be assigned to certificates that have been abandoned due to age.
nodes.label: Improper Validation of Certificate Expiration

nodes.Description:
CWE-613: Insufficient Session Expiration
According to WASC, "Insufficient Session Expiration is when a web site permits an attacker to reuse old session credentials or session IDs for authorization."
nodes.label: Insufficient Session Expiration

nodes.Description:
CWE-910: Use of Expired File Descriptor
The product uses or accesses a file descriptor after it has been closed.
nodes.label: Use of Expired File Descriptor

nodes.Description:
CWE-672: Operation on a Resource after Expiration or Release
The product uses, accesses, or otherwise operates on a resource after that resource has been expired, released, or revoked.
nodes.label: Operation on a Resource after Expiration or Release

nodes.Description:
CWE-825: Expired Pointer Dereference
The product dereferences a pointer that contains a location for memory that was previously valid, but is no longer valid.
nodes.label: Expired Pointer Dereference
